UI_visible_response: Read 18 web pagesView Page Details“Under the Dome” is a science fiction novel written by Stephen King and published in 2009. It tells the story of the residents of Chester's Mill, Maine, who are suddenly and inexplicably sealed off from the rest of the world by an invisible, impenetrable barrier known as "the Dome". The book explores themes such as the impact of isolation on human behavior, the abuse of power, and the struggle for survival. It features a large cast of characters, including Dale Barbara, an Iraq War veteran who becomes a leader in the crisis, and Big Jim Rennie, a corrupt politician who tries to seize control. The novel has been adapted into a television series and has received positive reviews for its complex plot and exploration of human nature.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: “Under the Dome” is a science fiction novel written by Stephen King and published in 2009[^2^]. It tells the story of the residents of Chester's Mill, Maine, who are suddenly and inexplicably sealed off from the rest of the world by an invisible, impenetrable barrier known as "the Dome"[^3^]. The book explores themes such as the impact of isolation on human behavior, the abuse of power, and the struggle for survival[^1^]. It features a large cast of characters, including Dale Barbara, an Iraq War veteran who becomes a leader in the crisis, and Big Jim Rennie, a corrupt politician who tries to seize control[^1^]. The novel has been adapted into a television series and has received positive reviews for its complex plot and exploration of human nature[^2^].
